body_html: TensorFlow is designed to run on private networks that rely on other mechanisms (firewalls, VLANs, VPC, etc.) for network security. The present implementation performs no additional authentication, authorization, or encryption of requests or responses. As the comments in grpc_server_lib.h suggest, it would be possible to override the gRPC server and client classes to employ encryption, but there is no API for doing this at present.
body_text: TensorFlow is designed to run on private networks that rely on other mechanisms (firewalls, VLANs, VPC, etc.) for network security. The present implementation performs no additional authentication, authorization, or encryption of requests or responses. As the comments in grpc_server_lib.h suggest, it would be possible to override the gRPC server and client classes to employ encryption, but there is no API for doing this at present.
body: TensorFlow is designed to run on private networks that rely on other mechanisms (firewalls, VLANs, VPC, etc.) for network security. The present implementation performs no additional authentication, authorization, or encryption of requests or responses. As the comments in `grpc_server_lib.h` suggest, it would be possible to override the gRPC server and client classes to employ encryption, but there is no API for doing this at present.
